column17: unfertilized grasslands
column48: The study has 9 treatments. I used the control and the most intensive treatment. The most intesive treatment is marked in the paper as V5 and it is the treatment with the highest quantaty of manure applied yearly. The biodiversity data in this study is a bit weird: they report total number of species and number of forb species but in some treatments, the number of forb species is higher than the total number of species, which does not make sense.

column17: Although this is a monoculture, it is managed without pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. It is fertilised though at a level of 44±22 kg N/ha.
column48: Aggregated abundance data in the supporting information. The study looks both at interior and edge of the fields. I used the interior data as we are not considering edge effects in our meta-anlysis.

column17: Monoculture, fertlized at a level of 209±22 kg N/ha. Irigation and use of pesticides is not mentioned.
